properties.name: Barden Tower

properties.description: Motte and Bailey in someone's garden

properties.name: Ludlow Castle
properties.wheelchair:description: Very difficult to access. Shop unaccessible. Rough terrain and no access obviously to structures such as the towers. Can possibly access main grounds with a strong push and a manual wheelchair.

properties.description: Medieval Motte and Baily Castle. Appears not to have its own name.
Bourne Castle was a Norman motte and double bailey castle. It was destroyed after being used by Oliver Cromwell's troops in 1645, and a farmhouse was built on its site
properties.name: Bourne Castle
Knockin Castle
properties.note: All that remains of Knockin Castle today is a large tree-covered mound of earth.

properties.name: Site of Hamilton of Torrance Castle

properties.description: Cliff castles are coastal promontories adapted as enclosures and fortified on the landward side by the construction of one or more ramparts accompanied by ditches. On the seaward side the precipitous cliffs of the promontory provided a natural defence, on
properties.name: Crane Castle
